title: Quick chinese-style omelette
time: Takes 10 min to make, 10 min to cook, plus marinating
description: This Chinese-style dish is an inventive alternative to a normal omelette recipe. What’s more, it’s ready in minutes.
ingredients: 250g pork escalopes or tenderloin fillet, thinly sliced

method.Step 1: Marinate the pork in the oyster sauce for 10 minutes. Mix the eggs with the ginger and finely sliced spring onion in a small bowl and set aside.

method.Step 2: Heat 1 tbsp groundnut oil in a wok until hot. Add the pork and stir-fry for 5 minutes until browned and sticky, then add the stir-fry vegetables and shredded spring onion. Stir-fry for a further 2 minutes until the pork is cooked through.

method.Step 3: Meanwhile, heat a splash of oil in a frying pan and, when hot, add half the egg mix, swirling to cover the base of the pan. Cook for 2-3 minutes until just set, then transfer to a warm plate and top with half the pork stir-fry.

method.Step 4: Repeat with the remaining egg and stir-fry mixtures. Serve with soy sauce for drizzling.
